section_a_workflow_definition.q02_trigger_event: Customer submits a support request via email or web form
section_a_workflow_definition.q03_business_objective: Route tickets to the right specialist and provide first response within 2 hours

section_c_systems_handoffs.q11_manual_data_transfers: Manual routing of tickets, manual creation of bug tickets in Jira
section_c_systems_handoffs.q12_human_decision_gates: Support manager manually determines category and assigns to specialist

section_d_failure_cost.q13_common_failures: Manual routing is slow, miscategorization happens about 20% of the time, no integration between Zendesk and Jira
section_d_failure_cost.q14_cost_if_slow_or_failed: Each SLA miss costs approximately $75 in customer credits, misrouted tickets waste 30 minutes of specialist time, duplicate work, customer churn (12% annual churn rate, average customer lifetime value: $18,000)

section_e_priority.q15_one_thing_to_fix: Auto-route tickets based on keywords and past ticket history

attachments.notes: Client has 1 support manager and 6 specialists, they work 24/5 with an offshore team
